title: Premium 2026-style construction company single-page marketing site (animated, conversion-focused)

requirements.summary: Create a cohesive, premium single-page layout with modern grid, spacing, rounded corners, soft shadows, and subtle glass/gradient touches using a charcoal/yellow/white palette.
acceptanceCriteria: The landing page renders all requested sections in the specified order and feels visually cohesive and premium.
The design uses a grid-based layout, large section spacing, rounded corners, and soft shadows consistently.
Color palette is primarily charcoal black + construction yellow + white.

file_operations.description: Create the single-page composition rendering sections in the required order (Hero, About, Services, Projects, Why Choose Us, Testimonials, Contact/CTA) plus Footer, with premium layout structure and shared spacing system.
Add a layout wrapper providing consistent max-width container grid, section padding rules, and premium surface styling (rounded corners, soft shadows, subtle gradients/glass).
Create a reusable Section wrapper component to standardize grid layout, vertical spacing, and optional background treatments across sections.
Extend theme tokens to support the premium charcoal/yellow/white brand palette, modern spacing, and consistent shadows/radii used throughout the page.
Add global Tailwind directives and premium base styling (typography scale, background/foreground colors, consistent focus styles) aligned with charcoal/yellow/white branding.
Ensure the app renders the new single-page App.tsx and applies global styling import for the premium marketing layout.

requirements.summary: Implement a sticky transparent navbar that transitions style on scroll and smooth-scrolls to each section anchor.
acceptanceCriteria: Navbar is fixed at the top and remains usable on all screen sizes.
On scroll, navbar transitions to a more readable style (background and contrast change) with smooth animation.
Clicking navbar links smoothly scrolls to the correct section.

file_operations.description: Create a sticky, initially transparent navbar with responsive layout and links to section anchors; add scroll-state styling (solid/blurred background + stronger border/shadow) with smooth transitions.
Add a small hook to observe scroll position and expose a boolean for when the navbar should change style (throttled/raf for performance).
Add a helper to smoothly scroll to section IDs with sticky-navbar offset handling and accessibility-friendly focus management.
Wire Navbar into the single-page layout and ensure each required section has a stable ID that matches the navbar links.
Enable smooth scrolling behavior for in-page navigation while ensuring reduced-motion users are respected. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Build the Hero section with full-width cinematic background, exact headline text, two CTAs, and subtle parallax/fade-in animations.
acceptanceCriteria: Hero uses a full-width background image with an overlay/contrast treatment to keep text readable.
Headline text matches exactly: “Building the Future with Strength & Precision”.
Two CTA buttons are visible above the fold on desktop and remain accessible on mobile.
Hero content animates in (fade/slide) and the background has a subtle parallax/scroll effect without jank.

file_operations.description: Implement the Hero with full-width background image, overlay for readability, exact headline “Building the Future with Strength & Precision”, subtitle, and two prominent CTA buttons (“Get a Quote”, “View Projects”) that scroll to Contact/CTA and Projects.
Add an optional lightweight parallax hook for the hero background that uses requestAnimationFrame and disables itself for reduced-motion users.
Create a reusable reveal-on-mount / reveal-on-scroll wrapper (fade/slide) used by the Hero content. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Wire HeroSection into the page at the top and ensure CTA buttons connect to the correct section IDs (Contact/CTA and Projects).

requirements.summary: Create an About Us split layout with overlapping image effect and smooth reveal-on-scroll animation.
acceptanceCriteria: On desktop, About shows a two-column split layout; on mobile it stacks logically with good spacing.
The image presentation includes an overlapping/offset layer effect (e.g., framed card, secondary accent block, or stacked images).
Section reveals with a smooth scroll-triggered animation.

file_operations.description: Implement About as a responsive split layout with an overlapping/offset image treatment (accent block/frame + image card) and premium typography/copy.
Add an IntersectionObserver hook that triggers once when a section enters the viewport to support reveal-on-scroll animations without repeated retriggering.
Extend the reveal wrapper to support scroll-triggered reveal via useInViewOnce and reduced-motion behavior. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Wire AboutSection after Hero and assign the required section ID for navbar navigation.

requirements.summary: Implement Services section with 3–6 responsive service cards including icons and premium hover micro-interactions.
acceptanceCriteria: Services render 3–6 cards with consistent spacing and alignment across breakpoints.
Each service card includes an icon, a clear title, and a short description in English.
Hovering a card triggers a lift and shadow transition (and optional subtle border/gradient change) smoothly.

file_operations.description: Build a responsive grid of 3–6 service cards (icon, title, description) with premium hover states (lift + shadow + subtle border/gradient accents) consistent with the site theme.
Add a minimal icon component or inline SVG set used by service cards and other icon-based sections to keep visual style consistent.
Wire ServicesSection into the page with the correct section ID for navbar scrolling.

requirements.summary: Create Featured Projects gallery (modern grid/masonry feel) with hover overlays and an accessible lightbox modal with next/previous navigation.
acceptanceCriteria: Projects display in a modern grid or masonry-like layout with consistent gutters.
Hovering a project reveals an overlay containing at least a project name and a short detail line.
Clicking a project opens a modal/lightbox with the larger image; user can close it and navigate to next/previous project.
Lightbox is keyboard accessible (Escape closes; focus is trapped within modal).

file_operations.description: Implement a modern project gallery using the generated project images with hover overlay details; clicking opens a lightbox and supports next/previous navigation.
Create an accessible lightbox modal with focus trap, Escape-to-close, and keyboard navigation (left/right) plus visible next/prev controls.
Add a small focus-trap hook to keep keyboard focus within the open lightbox modal and restore focus on close.
Wire ProjectsSection into the page and ensure its section ID matches the navbar link and Hero CTA (“View Projects”).

requirements.summary: Implement Why Choose Us with icon-based layout and animated statistic counters triggered once on entering the viewport.
acceptanceCriteria: Section displays multiple reasons/features with icons and concise English copy.
At least 3 statistics counters animate from 0 to target values on first view.
Animation triggers on scroll into view and does not continuously re-trigger on minor scroll changes.

file_operations.description: Build an icon-based reasons layout plus a stats area containing at least 3 counters that animate from 0 on first viewport entry.
Add a count-up hook that animates numeric values with requestAnimationFrame, triggers via useInViewOnce, and respects reduced motion.
Wire WhyChooseUsSection into the page and ensure correct section ID for navbar scrolling.

requirements.summary: Create a responsive testimonials carousel with smooth transitions and touch/swipe support.
acceptanceCriteria: Testimonials appear in a horizontally sliding carousel with smooth transitions.
Carousel includes controls (dots/arrows) and supports swipe on mobile.
Cards maintain premium styling (rounded corners, subtle shadows, readable typography).

file_operations.description: Implement a premium testimonial card carousel/slider with smooth transitions, dots/arrows, and swipe handling on mobile.
Add carousel state management (active index, next/prev, drag/swipe thresholds) used by Testimonials for responsive behavior.
Wire TestimonialsSection into the page and ensure correct section ID for navbar scrolling.

requirements.summary: Add a conversion-focused dark CTA section with bold typography and a prominent construction-yellow button.
acceptanceCriteria: CTA section has a clearly darker background than surrounding sections and strong typographic hierarchy.
CTA button is prominent and uses the accent color appropriately.
CTA section looks good on mobile and desktop with no cramped spacing.

file_operations.description: Create a dark-background CTA section with bold copy and a standout construction-yellow button; button scrolls to the Contact content within the same section or to a dedicated Contact anchor.
Wire CtaSection into the page after Testimonials and ensure it provides the required Contact/CTA anchor target for navbar and Hero CTA.

requirements.summary: Implement a minimal modern footer with contact info, quick links, and social icons matching the premium theme.
acceptanceCriteria: Footer includes: contact info, a list of quick links, and social icons.
Footer layout is responsive and maintains readability and spacing across breakpoints.
Footer styling matches site palette and typography.

file_operations.description: Build a responsive footer containing contact information, quick links (scroll-to-section), and social icons styled to match the premium charcoal/yellow/white theme.
Wire Footer at the bottom of the single-page layout and connect quick links to section IDs.

requirements.summary: Add consistent reveal-on-scroll animations and hover micro-interactions site-wide with performance and reduced-motion accessibility.
acceptanceCriteria: Major sections/components animate in as they enter the viewport (e.g., fade/slide) with consistent timing/easing.
Hover states exist for interactive elements (buttons, nav links, cards) with smooth transitions.
If the user prefers reduced motion, animations are reduced/disabled appropriately.

file_operations.description: Add a hook to detect prefers-reduced-motion and expose a boolean used to reduce/disable animations across components.
Standardize reveal animation timing/easing and integrate reduced-motion logic so animations are reduced/disabled appropriately. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add consistent transition defaults and accessible focus/hover styles for buttons/links/cards; include reduced-motion media query adjustments for smooth scrolling and animations.
Ensure navbar link and button hover/focus micro-interactions are consistent and accessible (visible focus states, smooth transitions).

requirements.summary: Ensure full responsiveness, premium typography hierarchy, and accessible interactions across all sections.
acceptanceCriteria: All sections render correctly on common breakpoints (mobile/tablet/desktop) without overflow or layout breakage.
Typography uses a modern sans-serif with a premium feel and strong hierarchy (headlines, subheads, body).
Interactive elements meet basic accessibility expectations (focus states visible, sufficient contrast for text).

file_operations.description: Refine responsive container widths, spacing, and typography scale tokens to ensure consistent hierarchy across breakpoints.
Ensure hero typography, CTA sizing, and layout remain above-the-fold and usable on mobile/tablet/desktop, with no text overflow on small screens.
Verify service grid breakpoints, equal spacing, and hover/focus states for keyboard users.
Ensure gallery layout and overlays are responsive and accessible (hover has keyboard-accessible equivalent, images have alt text).
Ensure carousel is responsive, swipe works on touch devices, and controls are reachable with keyboard with visible focus.
Set a modern sans-serif stack and enforce readable line lengths, contrast-friendly foreground colors, and visible focus outlines consistent with the premium design.

requirements.summary: Add the required generated construction images under frontend/public/assets/generated and wire them into Hero, About, and Projects sections.
acceptanceCriteria: All generated images are present under frontend/public/assets/generated and are referenced directly by the frontend.
Hero uses the generated cinematic construction background image.
Featured Projects uses the generated project images, and About uses the generated about image.

file_operations.description: Add the generated hero background image asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/construction-hero-bg.dim_1920x1080.png.
Add the generated about image asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/about-team.dim_1400x1000.png.
Add the generated project image asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/project-01.dim_1200x900.png.
Add the generated project image asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/project-02.dim_1200x900.png.
Add the generated project image asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/project-03.dim_1200x900.png.
Add the generated project image asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/project-04.dim_1200x900.png.
Add the generated project image asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/project-05.dim_1200x900.png.
Add the generated project image asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/project-06.dim_1200x900.png.
Reference frontend/public/assets/generated/construction-hero-bg.dim_1920x1080.png as the hero background image with overlay treatment for text readability.
Reference frontend/public/assets/generated/about-team.dim_1400x1000.png in the split About layout with the requested overlapping image effect.

Reference the generated project images (frontend/public/assets/generated/project-01.dim_1200x900.png through frontend/public/assets/generated/project-06.dim_1200x900.png) as the gallery sources and lightbox content.
